channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: Lombard Odier, Hong Leong Team Up for Southeast Asia Wealth
item.description: Lombard Odier struck its seventh partnership in Asia as the Swiss wealth manager tied up with Hong Leong Bank Bhd., a move that underscores how financial firms are expanding to cater to the rising wealth in the region.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Ng

media:content.media:description: A Lombard Odier bank branch sign in Geneva. Photographer: Luke MacGregor/

item.title: Hungary Warns Wage-Hike Plan at Risk From Weak Economy
item.description: Hungary’s government warned it may need to renegotiate minimum wage hikes planned for 2026 due to weaker-than-expected growth, in the latest downbeat economic outlook from officials.
item.dc:creator: Marton Kasnyik

media:content.media:description: A market vendor in Budapest. Photographer: Akos Stiller/Bloomberg

item.title: Stocks Rise on Trump’s Tariff Delay; Dollar Wavers: Markets Wrap
item.description: European stocks climbed along with US equity futures after President Donald Trump extended a deadline on aggressive euro area tariffs, reinforcing a pattern of leaving markets guessing by making trade threats before backtracking.
item.dc:creator: Robert Brand

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) during the Hinge Health Inc. initial public offering (IPO) in New York, US, on Thursday, May 22, 2025. Hinge Health Inc. and a group of investors raised $437 million in the digital physical therapy provider's US initial public offering, pricing shares at the top of a marketed range.

item.title: New Tariff Twist Does More Dollar Damage: 3-Minute MLIV
item.description: Guy Johnson, Kriti Gupta and Paul Dobson break down today's key themes for analysts and investors on "Bloomberg: The Opening Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: China Raises Cross-Border Yuan Use Requirement for Major Banks
item.description: China’s central bank asked its major lenders to raise the share of yuan when facilitating cross-border trade, in its latest push for the use of the currency as the world grapples with the onslaught of tariffs by the US.
item.dc:creator: John Liu

media:content.media:description: China has been actively advancing the cross-border use of the yuan. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

item.title: Oil Rises After Trump Delays Deadline for EU Tariffs Decision
item.description: Oil rose as the market weighed the outlook for easing trade tensions after President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for higher tariffs on the European Union.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen, Rakteem Katakey

item.title: India Debuts New Weather Model to Help Farming, Flood Planning
item.description: The southwest monsoon’s early arrival in India this year is good news for crops, but exactly when, where, and how much rain will fall over the next few months are still difficult questions to answer.
item.dc:creator: Mary Hui, Rakesh Sharma

media:content.media:description: Floodwater outside a house in Guwahati, India, on May 20.

item.title: Emerging Market Currencies Gain as ‘Stars Align’ for Sector
item.description: Emerging market currencies rose, as President Donald Trump’s move to extend a deadline for aggressive tariffs on the European Union bolstered risk appetite.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom, Srinivasan Sivabalan, Catherine Bosley

item.title: Gold Slips as Haven Demand Eases After Trump Delays EU Tariffs
item.description: Gold slipped as haven demand was dented by signs that President Donald Trump may be easing his aggressive stance on trade with the European Union.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

item.title: Italy’s Banco BPM Appeals UniCredit Bid Delay in Next Escalation
item.description: Banco BPM SpA is seeking to reverse a decision to suspend UniCredit SpA’s tender offer for the smaller rival, further escalating the tensions around the deal.
item.dc:creator: Sonia Sirletti

media:content.media:description: A Banco BPM SpA bank branch in Milan, Italy, on Friday, Nov. 29, 2024. The Italian government is examining ways to counter UniCredit SpA’s unsolicited takeover bid for smaller Italian rival Banco BPM.

item.title: Meiji Yasuda’s Paper Bond Losses Jump Eightfold as Rates Climb
item.description: Four of Japan’s biggest life insurers reported about $60 billion of combined unrealized losses on their domestic bond holdings for the latest fiscal year, underscoring the risks they face as interest rates climb. For now, they aren’t overly concerned.
item.dc:creator: Nao Sano, Taiga Uranaka

media:content.media:description: The Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance headquarters in Tokyo.

item.title: ECB Faces Greater Risk Inflation Will Undershoot 2%, Simkus Says
item.description: There’s a growing danger that inflation will fall short of the European Central Bank’s 2% target, according to Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus.
item.dc:creator: Milda Seputyte

media:content.media:description: The ECB headquarters in Frankfurt, Germany. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg

item.title: Why Asset Allocators Love Multi-Strategy Hedge Funds
item.description: And the importance of compensation structure.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: Buildings in the Manhattan skyline in New York, U.S., on Thursday June 17, 2021. New York state's pandemic mandates were lifted last week, after 70% of the adult population has now been given at least one dose of a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Odd Lots: Why Allocators Love Multi-Strat Hedge Funds (Podcast)
item.description: Multi-strategy hedge funds have been having a moment with big asset allocators pouring billions of dollars into names like Millennium and Citadel. And given all the growth, multi-strat funds have also been battling each other for talent. But why, exactly, do big investors seem to love multi-strats so much? What actually makes a multi-strat good to invest in? And how do fees and compensation work? In this episode, we speak with Ronan Cosgrave, a partner at Albourne Partners, which advises institu
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

item.title: European Earnings 'Surprisingly Normal,' Says Citi's Manthey
item.description: Head of European Equity Strategy at Citigroup, Beata Manthey says 'just weeks ago, Europe saw 'recessionary' EPS revisions amid heightened macro/policy uncertainty.' But added that 'Stoxx 600 companies have delivered surprisingly 'normal' results throughout the first quarter reporting season, with a historically typical share and size of earnings beats.' Manthey joined "Daybreak Europe" on Bloomberg TV on May 22. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Elusive Peace Hits Ukraine Bonds While Nearby Markets Surge
item.description: One of the most popular emerging-market trades around Donald Trump’s return to the White House is stumbling.
item.dc:creator: Andras Gergely, Jorgelina Do Rosario

item.title: European Stocks Rally as Trump Extends Deadline for EU Tariffs
item.description: European stocks gained after President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the region to face higher tariffs, as investors weigh the prospects for a longer-term trade deal.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hsu, Macarena Munoz Montijano

item.title: Shorter Indian Bonds Set to Extend Gains on RBI’s Record Payout
item.description: India’s shorter-tenor bonds are set to extend their outperformance as analysts expect the central bank’s record dividend payout will further boost the cash surplus in the banking system.
item.dc:creator: Subhadip Sircar

media:content.media:description: The Reserve Bank of India headquarters in Mumbai, India. Photographer: Dhiraj Singh/Bloomberg

item.title: European Gas Rises Amid Supply Cuts at Norway’s Troll Field
item.description: European natural gas prices extended gains after unplanned capacity cuts were announced at Norway’s giant Troll field, further curbing flows from the region’s top supplier.
item.dc:creator: Carolynn Look

media:content.media:description: The Troll natural gas and oil field in the North Sea near Bergen, Norway. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe

item.title: South Africa Invites Trump to Explore Business Opportunities
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said the nation invited his US counterpart to send officials to the country to “explore opportunities for deepening investment and trade.”
item.dc:creator: Ana Monteiro

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump, right, and Cyril Ramaphosa, in Washington, DC. Photographer: Jim Lo Scalzo/EPA

item.title: European Solar Profits Tumble to Record Low on Long Sunny Spring
item.description: Profits at Europe’s solar parks have sunk to record lows, raising concerns that the more the industry expands, the farther prices will fall.
item.dc:creator: Eva Brendel

media:content.media:description: A solar park in France. Photographer: Nathan Laine/Bloomberg

item.title: EU Tariff Deadline; Trump Weighs Russia Sanctions | Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/26/2025
item.description: US President Donald Trump saying he's extending the deadline for the EU to face 50% tariffs until July 9. Also on the show: Trump says he is considering new sanctions against Russia; US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expects several large trade deals to be announced in the coming weeks; Southeast Asian leaders start two days of talks in Kuala Lumpur; Trump's pivot on Africa; Trump has announced what he calls a "planned partnership" between US Steel and Japan's Nippon Steel. Guests include: Ben Powell, Blackrock Investment Institute, Chief Middle East & APAC Investment Strategist; Zeina Rizk, Amwal Capital Partners, Fixed Income Partner and Co-Head. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Japan’s Stocks Solid as Trump Rhetoric Cools; Nippon Steel Gains
item.description: Japanese shares gained for a second day on hopes of softer trade policies from US President Donald Trump, after he extended the deadline for higher duties on European Union goods and backed a deal between Nippon Steel Corp. and US Steel Corp.
item.dc:creator: Alice French, Toshiro Hasegawa

item.title: Chinese EV Stocks Tumble After BYD Slashes Prices as Much as 34%
item.description: BYD Co. led Chinese electric vehicle stocks lower in Hong Kong on Monday, as investors digested the auto giant’s sweeping price cuts of as much as 34% late last week.
item.dc:creator: Danny Lee

media:content.media:description: Electric vehicles from BYD Co. at the Shanghai Auto Show.

item.title: Shipping Bottlenecks in Europe Send a Warning to US, Asia
item.description: Port congestion is worsening at key gateways in northern Europe and other hubs, according to a new report which suggests trade wars could spread maritime disruptions to Asia and the US and push up shipping rates.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Murray

media:content.media:description: The container terminal at Bremerhaven port in Bremerhaven, Germany, on April 22, 2025.

item.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/26/2025
item.description: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bloomberg: The China Show 5/26/2025
item.description: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: GMO Group Scraps $2 Billion Share Sale Plan of Internet Unit
item.description: The Japanese conglomerate GMO Internet Group Inc. canceled a planned share offering of one of its listed arms after the stock surged in recent months, pushing up the unit’s valuation.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura

item.title: Dollar Extends Drop as EU Tariff Delay Boosts Risk-Sensitive FX
item.description: A gauge of the dollar slid toward its lowest level in nearly two years after US President Donald Trump’s decision to postpone higher tariffs on the European Union boosted other currencies with strong links to global trade.
item.dc:creator: Masaki Kondo

item.title: 'Stars Align' For Emerging Markets: Morgan Stanley
item.description: Amy Oldenburg, the Head of Emerging Markets Equity for Morgan Stanley Investment Management, speaks on Bloomberg's Insight with Haslinda Amin about investment opportunities in emerging markets. (Source: Bloomberg)
